lines.content: Used ChatGPT to generate javadoc comments.
ChatGPT may not always follow the exact convention specified for our course,
requiring me to manually verify its output.

Blazingly fast CLI-based task manager chatbot for those who thrive in the terminal.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 installed in your computer.
3. Navigate into the directory containing the `.jar` file.
4. Run `java -jar glendon.jar` to start the application.
The user can add 3 types of tasks to the task list: Todos, Deadlines and Events.
The description can contain multiple words.
Displays all tasks in the task list.
Finds tasks whose description contains any of the given keywords and displays all matching tasks.
- All the above inputs should display the task with description "play hollow knight silksong"
Mark/unmark a specified task as completed/not completed, using its displayed index.
Delete a specified task using its displayed index.
Glendon automatically saves the task list to `data/tasks.txt` whenever changes are made.

* Unit tests for the Parser class.
* Tests that a valid ToDo command is parsed into a ToDo task successfully.
assertEquals("[T][ ] buy new keyboard", Parser.parseTask("todo buy new keyboard").toString());
* Tests that an invalid ToDo command (missing description) throws an exception
* Tests that a valid Deadline command with a properly formatted date is parsed
* Tests that a Deadline command missing the required "/by" segment throws an
* exception with the expected error message.
* Tests that a Deadline command with an incorrectly formatted date string
* throws an exception with the expected error message.
* Tests that a valid Event command with properly formatted start and end date
* times is parsed into an Event task successfully.
* Tests that an Event command missing required date-time components throws an
* exception with the expected error message.
* Tests that an Event command with incorrectly formatted start and end
* date-time strings throws an exception with the expected error message.
assertEquals("Invalid event start or end datetime format", e.getMessage());
* Unit tests for the serialization methods in the Storage class.
* Tests that a completed ToDo task is serialized into the expected storage format.
* Tests that a completed Deadline task is serialized into the expected storage format,
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("sign up for cca",
assertEquals("D | 1 | sign up for cca | 2025-08-24", Storage.serializeDeadline(deadline));
* Tests that a completed Event task is serialized into the expected storage format,
* including both start and end date-times.
